title: [Large-scale] Foundations of Participatory Technology Design for Children with Communication Disorders

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic special education and communication disorders, experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Learning a technology design framework applicable to the mathematics domain, emphasizing participatory research methods in collaboration with clinical experts.

learning_goals: Learners can classify at least three key characteristics of children with communication disorders and incorporate them into learning design
Learners can explain the process of planning technology-based communication aids in collaboration with an SLP (Speech-Language Pathologist)
Learners can derive core functionalities of communication support prototypes by applying participatory design (DBR - Design-Based Research)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
